title: Recommend online font shops
content:
I’m trying to find some new online fontshops along the lines of [Process Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/), [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.lineto.com/), [Textaxis](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.textaxis.com/) and [Identikal](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.identikalshop.com/) but I’m having no luck.

Not big houses, like Adobe, Linotype, etc...

I really appreciate how Process Type displays their information - I can get a good idea what I’m dealing with from their site.

Anything else out there on the horizon?

I’m not sure how I could do an effective search in the forums to do this otherwise...

(We could exclude Emigre, Fountain, Garage Fonts, House Industries as I’ve already been through them.)

 [‹ wedding invitation font suggestions/questions....](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14808 "Go to previous forum topic") [Good Newspaper Serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14807 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vaaaska

comments.content:
A friend recommended this...and surprisingly there are quality shops to be found via this site. This isn’t merely about free fonts (you normally get what you pay for)...

[Font Leech](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/fontleech.com/)

Via this site I found [Cape Arcona](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/cape-arcona.com/) which has some quite nice stuff that fits with what we’re thinking about.

I’ve been picking through this link.

[http://www.beadesigngroup.com/blog/archives/2005/07/typorama.html#more](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.beadesigngroup.com/blog/archives/2005/07/typorama.html#more "http://www.beadesigngroup.com/blog/archives/2005/07/typorama.html#more")

Nice starting point. I think Process and Lineto are two of the best foundry sites on the web.

Also:  
 [Village](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.vllg.com/) (just launched)  
 [OurType](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.ourtype.com/) (Flash at its finest, by group94)  
 [Letterhead](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/) (the best at old school)

I would include Psy/Ops ( [http://wwwpsyops.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/wwwpsyops.com/ "http://wwwpsyops.com")) to the list.  
You might also find my own site MAC Rhino Fonts interesting?  
 [http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827234729/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")

Cheers
